2.text: Now again my conversation is in bitterness, and the force of my scourging weighs more heavily on me because of my mourning.

3.text: Who will grant me that I might know and find him, and that I may approach even to his throne?

4.text: I would place judgment before his eye, and my mouth would fill with criticism,

5.text: so that I may know the words that he will answer me and understand what he will say to me.

6.text: I do not want him to contend with me with much strength, nor to overwhelm me with the bulk of his greatness.

7.text: Let him show fairness in response to me, and let my judgment reach to victory.

8.text: If I go to the east, he does not appear; if I go to the west, I will not understand him.

9.text: If I turn to the left, what can I do? I will not take hold of him. If I turn myself to the right, I will not see him.

10.text: Truly, he knows my way and has tested me like gold that passes through fire.

11.text: My feet have been following his footsteps; I have kept to his way and have not strayed from it.

12.text: I have not withdrawn from the commands of his lips, and the words of his mouth I have hidden in my sinews.

13.text: For he is alone, and no one is able to disturb his intention; and whatever his spirit wills, that he accomplishes.

14.text: And when he fulfills his will in me, many other similar ones will also be present with him.

15.text: And, for this reason, I have been troubled at his presence, and, when I consider him, I am approached by fear.

16.text: God has weakened my heart, and the Almighty has confused me.

17.text: Yet I have not perished because of the threatening darkness, nor has gloom covered my face.
